gov.usgs.anss.net

Class Holding

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.net.Holding
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public final class Holding
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    This class encapsulates one run of continuous data in the holdings table. It updates the holding table based on several algorithms depending on use including a lazy round robin write used by the TcpHoldings program to handle real time collection of holdings. It uses prepared statements and a single connection of the database (all static) and limits the writing pace based on that.

    • Method Detail

      • setDoNotAutoWrite

        public static void setDoNotAutoWrite()
        All Holdings are set to not update the database. Useful for using this class in a report which does not want to ever write the holdings back to the DB.

      • replaceHolding

        public void replaceHolding(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String ty,
                           long time,
                           long ms)
        re-populate this holding with entirely new information (similar to creating a new one, but it simply reuses an existing object. It updates the DB etc.
        Parameters:
        name - The seedname for the holding
        ty - The type of holdings (2 char) like "CW"
        time - The time in millis for the first sample of the holdings
        ms - The duration of the holding in milliseconds

      • reload

        public void reload(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String ty,
                   long time,
                   long ms)
        reload this holding with entirely new information (similar to creating a new one, but it simply reuses an existing object. This does not cause the DB to be updated as compared to replaceHolding().
        Parameters:
        name - The seedname for the holding
        ty - The type of holdings (2 char) like "CW"
        time - The time in millis for the first sample of the holdings
        ms - The duration of the holding in milliseconds

        public boolean doUpdate(int ms)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Number of records modified

      • doUpdate

        public boolean doUpdate()

        Returns:
